Module User Interface

Module Summary
User Interface The user interface will permit the user to specify the visualization's parameters. MEL offers an array of tools for the construction of user interfaces, as well as for the collection and transmission of the provided information. Our user interface will include a variety of sliders, radio buttons, color selectors, etc. which will solicit parameter values for each of our supported user preferences. This generated information will ultimately be passed on to the animation module for use in visualization.
 

Components Summary
Basics Section
File Browser The file brower is used for selecting an audio file.
Checkbox: Automatic Import If a user checks this box, audio file will be automaticaly imported to Maya timeline.
Radio Button: Shape Selection Three options are provided here: sphere, cube, and speaker.
Slider: Quantity Selection This slider determines how many band/geometric objects will be generated. Each cube or sphere is dreven by a band.
Color Section
Color Selector Colors of both left and right ends are determined here. Objects' colors will be filled using a gradient from left to right.
Raido Button: Interpolation Method Selection Two options are provided here: HSV and RGB. HSV interpolation is better for bright colors directly across the color spectrum. RGB interpolation is better for combinations which include a very light or a very dark color.
Raido Button: Color Driver Selection Two options are provided here: color fixed and driven by audio
Button: Create Scene Once this button is clicked, a new scene will be created by procedure "grapes".
Rendering Section
Slider: Start Frame The start frame is determined by this slider.
Slider: End Frame The end frame is determined by this slider.
Button: Render Animation Render a scene. The user can specify srart and end frame.
